flawed_nl_solution:
Mark buys 6 $2 cans of soup, meaning he spends 6*2= <<6*2=12>>12 dollars on soup.
Mark buys 2 $5 loaves of bread, meaning he spends 2*5= <<2*5=10>>10 dollars on bread.
Mark buys 2 $3 boxes of cereal, meaning he spends 2*3= <<2*3=6>>6 dollars on cereal.
Mark buys 2 $4 gallons of milk, meaning he spends 2*4= <<2*4=8>>8 dollars on milk.
All added together, this means Mark spends 12+10+6+8= <<12+10+6+8=63>>63 dollars
Since Mark only has $10 bills, he spends 63/10= <<63/10=6.3>>6.3 tens on it, which rounds up to 7 as you cannot spend .6 of an undividable item.
#### 7

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 36, not 63. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
